intro: Picridium tingitanum var. tenellum, commonly known as the Moroccan picrid, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of North Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant thrives in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It is often found in rocky habitats and is considered an endemic species to the region. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
